snippet: During his tenure as the United States attorney in Manhattan, Preet Bharara has embraced the media spotlight while fighting attempts to politicize justice.
abstract: Profile of Preet Bharara, United States attorney for Southern District of New York, who has waged several highly publicized fights against terrorism, corruption and civil rights violations during his five-year tenure; his efforts to investigate Gov Andrew M Cuomo's disbanding of government ethics commission has led to public clash between two of New York's most powerful Democrats.

byline.original: By BENJAMIN WEISER and BEN PROTESS

lead_paragraph: During his tenure as the United States attorney in Manhattan, Preet Bharara has embraced the media spotlight while fighting attempts to politicize justice.

headline.main: In Five Years, a Federal Prosecutor Has Taken On Terrorism, Corruption and Cuomo
headline.print_headline: Taking On Terrorism, Corruption and Cuomo

keywords.value: Moreland Commission to Investigate Public Corruption (NYS)
keywords.name: organizations
